channel.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
channel.description:
Hey guys ^_^ Sat at school the other day chillin' like a boss during a reccess. when suddenly a wild classmate appeared, showing me this: [url='https://twitter.com/Doug_Rattmann']https://twitter.com/Doug_Rattmann[/url] My friend told me that there had been lot's of indicators showing that the man behind the profile at least had to be some sort of steam insider.
One of the first things he posted was a set of binary code, that when translated would show following text: "The hOur is coMing Our Relaxation is oveR. this is just the calm befOre the storm Wait and see." during early December he's been spitting out tons of weird transmissions(have a look at his recent posts) numbers from these transmissions have shown to be somehow connected with the numbers shown at the right side of the screen in this award film: [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7AuxeLdRzno']https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7AuxeLdRzno[/url]
So.. Do you guys think that all this is indicating some sort of hints about the release of Valve's next game? or is it just an ambitious troll making a false profile, and a bunch of random scientific shit placed in a video to make it look cool and realistic?

item.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
item.dc:creator: Gedesnegl
item.description:
Cool!
So he’s not fake or what? xD

item.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
item.dc:creator: MarshmallowRadiation
item.description:
Jim_DiGriz:

They’ve already stated they would be releasing another Portal 2 DLC in early 2012. I don’t know why they would start an ARG just for that.

Because they’re not starting a new one but just posting hints on a twitter account they already have?

Read full topic

item.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
item.dc:creator: RedShirt
item.description:
Dec. 12, 2011, ETA no less then 60 days. What happens on or after 2/10/12?

Dec. 10, 2011, It βegins. Did you notice the Greek letter substitution? The letter Beta?

As for the code… any thoughts? It could be coordinates, if you take the numbers in pairs. A quick check shows that they would all be Northern Hemisphere and largely in North Africa, Europe and Russia.

Read full topic
item.source: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?

item.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
item.dc:creator: Gedesnegl
item.description:
rufus83:

If this person has no connection to valve, then these messages they’re posting are pretty odd. I’d say, if this has no connection anywhere, that this person just randomly posting stuff like this must be a pretty big fuckin weirdo.

Yeah, Not to mention the fact that he’s following two other people that doesn’t really seem to have had any other purpose than to make him look realistic. And even these people have been posting quite a bit, although not since sometimes in April.

Read full topic

item.title: Doug_rattman Twitter account, real or fake?
item.dc:creator: Gedesnegl
item.description:
Hey guys
Sat at school the other day chillin’ like a boss during a reccess.
when suddenly a wild classmate appeared, showing me this:
https://twitter.com/Doug_Rattmann
My friend told me that there had been lot’s of indicators showing that the man behind the profile at least had to be some sort of steam insider.

One of the first things he posted was a set of binary code, that when translated would show following text:
“The hOur is coMing Our Relaxation is oveR.
this is just the calm befOre the storm Wait and see.”
during early December he’s been spitting out tons of weird transmissions(have a look at his recent posts)
numbers from these transmissions have shown to be somehow connected with the numbers shown at the right side of the screen in this award film:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7AuxeLdRzno

So… Do you guys think that all this is indicating some sort of hints about the release of Valve’s next game? or is it just an ambitious troll making a false profile, and a bunch of random scientific shit placed in a video to make it look cool and realistic?
